intro: Gymnanthelia sennarensis, commonly known as the Sennarensis Gymnanthelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Gymnanthelia sennarensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
